result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: 44 days sentence credit if revoked.  DPAH scheduled for August 17, 2023 at 1:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.   Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
**  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  
May not have contact with Alyssa T., LKD, ST, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Faith L. King

defendant.name: King, Faith L.
defendant.address: c/o parents or guardian 6518 28th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

State's motion to revoke stipulated hold open agreement scheduled with Attorney Foster for 11/7/22 at 2:30 pm. Parties notified by email. Notice mailed out. Clerk attempted to call DE regarding court date; no answer & received message "memory is full" when calling last known phone number.
Attorney Alyssah Foster
Notice of Motion and Motion to Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement
of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

03:09 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Faith L. King, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence on count 2; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. No contact with/ Alyssa T., LKD (DOB5/25/04) & ST (DOB7/26/10).  44 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant. DPAH scheduled for August 17, 2023 at 1:30 pm.
and Waiver of Rights
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement

02:34 PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. DE appears in person with Atty William Michel.  Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:    Victim rights compliance for the purposes of entering a plea only. Matter is resolved by DPA. DE enters plea of guilty to Cts 1, 2. DE is found guilty on Ct2. Finding of guilt and entry of judgment withheld on Ct1 in accordance with DPA. Matter set over for sentencing on Ct2 to allow for victim notification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:39 PM   Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution. Defendant, Faith L. King, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel. Clerk: S.Shaw. Victim rights compliance.
MINUTES: Hearing held on behalf of Branch 3. Deft has no objection to Branch 6 hearing the matter. The matter is resolved. The parties request additional time to sort out the agreement. Request granted. Matter set over.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22
Signature bond set; refund cash bond. jk/nr ck# 22CH090025

****COURT WAIVES DEFT'S SIGNATURE ON THE AMENDED BOND DUE TO COVID*****
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: LKD, ST, AAW and Kristy D.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Michel.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Michel's bond motion. Court amends bond to $1,000 signature bond with same condition. Cash bond to be returned to poster.
$1000.00 posted

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Atty Wm. Michel appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft's appearance is waived.  Defense filed a bond motion.  State takes no position.  Court will reach out to Branch 1 to request permission to review a waiver report.  NOTE - email sent to Br 1 clerk requesting permission.  In the event the Court denies the bond motion, the Court will move up the deft's FPT/JS dates.
Scheduling Order
to Modify Bond Condition - filed by Atty. William Michel  kmk

Defendant Faith L. King appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
William Michel  kmk

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: LKD, ST, AAW and Kristy D.

01:08 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on April 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
